moves.1. d4: This is a short game I barely won because my opponent missed one move that could've saved him. I'm white.
moves.3... Bb4 4. Bd2 Bxc3 5. Bxc3 Nf6 6. e3 O: As you will see later, I quickly break into blacks king side, only it cost me.
moves.7. Bd3 Nc6 8. Ng5 g6: best move and most common to guard the h pawn.
moves.9. Be2 h6 10. Nh3 g5 11. f4: I'm trying to force equal pawn trades to break in.
moves.11... Ne4 12. Bf3: This was the mistake which cost me later, but it was the whole reason I broke into his king side. Just one of those mistakes that works out because your opponent gets the idea that your handicapped without the piece.
moves.13. bxc3: Black must have been planning to threaten me with a fork later. Who knows how that would've worked out.
moves.13... f5: Here's where I make the mistake of not moving my bishop.
moves.15. Nf2: I thought it would be better to have the knight since I could move my queen into his king side when he captures.
moves.17. g4: But I find a way in anyway.
moves.17... Rf6 18. g5 hxg5 19. fxg5 Rg6: This was blacks mistake where he let my queen get closer in for the kill.
moves.21. Nd3: I'm hoping to get my knight to e5, my last hope, which you will see.
moves.21... Kf8: Why do this? It was actually the move that gave me the win, in a way. It would have been good if he didn't move his rook to g8 later, but he did.
moves.22. Ne5 Rg7 23. Qh8+ Rg8: black should've moved his knightg there, but he's too late now.
moves.24. Qf6+: Only one move left, it's over.
moves.24... Qf7 25. Qxf7#: Not the longest game, but it's neat how such a bad opening leads to a win. I'd love to hear input, thx for reading.
